00064 static int
00065 write_lucid_keyblock(char **p, char *end, gss_krb5_lucid_key_t *key)
00066 {
00067         gss_buffer_desc tmp;
00068 
00069         if (WRITE_BYTES(p, end, key->type)) return -1;
00070         tmp.length = key->length;
00071         tmp.value = key->data;
00072         if (write_buffer(p, end, &tmp)) return -1;
00073         return 0;
00074 }
00075 
00076 static int
00077 prepare_krb5_rfc1964_buffer(gss_krb5_lucid_context_v1_t *lctx,
00078         gss_buffer_desc *buf)
00079 {
00080         char *p, *end;
00081         static int constant_zero = 0;
00082         unsigned char fakeseed[16] = { 0 };
00083         uint32_t word_send_seq;
00084         gss_krb5_lucid_key_t enc_key;
00085         int i;
00086         char *skd, *dkd;
00087 
00088         /*
00089          * The new Kerberos interface to get the gss context
00090          * does not include the seed or seed_init fields
00091          * because we never really use them.  But for now,
00092          * send down a fake buffer so we can use the same
00093          * interface to the kernel.
00094          */
00095         memset(&enc_key, 0, sizeof(enc_key));
00096 
00097         if (!(buf->value = calloc(1, MAX_CTX_LEN)))
00098                 goto out_err;
00099         p = buf->value;
00100         end = buf->value + MAX_CTX_LEN;
00101 
00102         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, lctx->initiate)) goto out_err;
00103 
00104         /* seed_init and seed not used by kernel anyway */
00105         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, constant_zero)) goto out_err;
00106         if (write_bytes(&p, end, &fakeseed, 16)) goto out_err;
00107 
00108         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, lctx->rfc1964_kd.sign_alg)) goto out_err;
00109         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, lctx->rfc1964_kd.seal_alg)) goto out_err;
00110         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, lctx->endtime)) goto out_err;
00111         word_send_seq = lctx->send_seq; /* XXX send_seq is 64-bit */
00112         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, word_send_seq)) goto out_err;
00113         if (write_oid(&p, end, &krb5oid)) goto out_err;
00114 
00115 #ifdef HAVE_HEIMDAL
00116         /*
00117          * The kernel gss code expects des-cbc-raw for all flavors of des.
00118          * The keytype from MIT has this type, but Heimdal does not.
00119          * Force the Heimdal keytype to 4 (des-cbc-raw).
00120          * Note that the rfc1964 version only supports DES enctypes.
00121          */
00122         if (lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.type != 4) {
00123                 printerr(2, "%s: overriding heimdal keytype (%d => %d)\n",
00124                          __FUNCTION__, lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.type, 4);
00125                 lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.type = 4;
00126         }
00127 #endif
00128         printerr(2, "%s: serializing keys with enctype %d and length %d\n",
00129                  __FUNCTION__, lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.type,
00130                  lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.length);
00131 
00132         /* derive the encryption key and copy it into buffer */
00133         enc_key.type = lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.type;
00134         enc_key.length = lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.length;
00135         if ((enc_key.data = calloc(1, enc_key.length)) == NULL)
00136                 goto out_err;
00137         skd = (char *) lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.data;
00138         dkd = (char *) enc_key.data;
00139         for (i = 0; i < enc_key.length; i++)
00140                 dkd[i] = skd[i] ^ 0xf0;
00141         if (write_lucid_keyblock(&p, end, &enc_key))
00142                 goto out_err;
00143         if (write_lucid_keyblock(&p, end, &lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key))
00144                 goto out_err;
00145         free(enc_key.data);
00146 
00147         buf->length = p - (char *)buf->value;
00148         return 0;
00149 out_err:
00150         printerr(0, "ERROR: failed serializing krb5 context for kernel\n");
00151         if (buf->value) {
00152                 free(buf->value);
00153                 buf->value = NULL;
00154         }
00155         buf->length = 0;
00156         if (enc_key.data) free(enc_key.data);
00157         return -1;
00158 }

00161 /* XXX Hack alert! XXX  Do NOT submit upstream! XXX */
00162 
00163 /* for 3DES */
00164 #define KG_USAGE_SEAL 22
00165 #define KG_USAGE_SIGN 23
00166 #define KG_USAGE_SEQ  24
00167 
00168 /* for rfc???? */
00169 #define KG_USAGE_ACCEPTOR_SEAL  22
00170 #define KG_USAGE_ACCEPTOR_SIGN  23
00171 #define KG_USAGE_INITIATOR_SEAL 24
00172 #define KG_USAGE_INITIATOR_SIGN 25
00173 
00174 /* Lifted from mit src/lib/gssapi/krb5/gssapiP_krb5.h */
00175 enum seal_alg {
00176   SEAL_ALG_NONE            = 0xffff,
00177   SEAL_ALG_DES             = 0x0000,
00178   SEAL_ALG_1               = 0x0001, /* not published */
00179   SEAL_ALG_MICROSOFT_RC4   = 0x0010, /* microsoft w2k;  */
00180   SEAL_ALG_DES3KD          = 0x0002
00181 };
00182 
00183 #define KEY_USAGE_SEED_ENCRYPTION       0xAA
00184 #define KEY_USAGE_SEED_INTEGRITY        0x55
00185 #define KEY_USAGE_SEED_CHECKSUM         0x99
00186 #define K5CLENGTH 5
00187 
00188 /* Flags for version 2 context flags */
00189 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_INITIATOR         0x00000001
00190 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_CFX               0x00000002
00191 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_ACCEPTOR_SUBKEY   0x00000004

00193 /* XXX Hack alert! XXX  Do NOT submit upstream! XXX */
00194 /* XXX Hack alert! XXX  Do NOT submit upstream! XXX */
00195 /*
00196  * We don't have "legal" access to these MIT-only
00197  * structures located in libk5crypto
00198  */
00199 extern void *krb5int_enc_arcfour;
00200 extern void *krb5int_enc_des3;
00201 extern void *krb5int_enc_aes128;
00202 extern void *krb5int_enc_aes256;
00203 
00204 static void
00205 key_lucid_to_krb5(const gss_krb5_lucid_key_t *lin, krb5_keyblock *kout)
00206 {
00207         memset(kout, 0, sizeof(*kout));
00208 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00209         kout->enctype = lin->type;
00210         kout->length = lin->length;
00211         kout->contents = lin->data;
00212 #else
00213         kout->keytype = lin->type;
00214         kout->keyvalue.length = lin->length;
00215         kout->keyvalue.data = lin->data;
00216 #endif
00217 }
00218 
00219 static int
00220 key_krb5_to_lucid(const krb5_keyblock *kin, gss_krb5_lucid_key_t *lout)
00221 {
00222         memset(lout, 0, sizeof(*lout));
00223 
00224 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00225         lout->data = malloc(kin->length);
00226         if (lout->data == NULL)
00227                 return KRB5_CC_NOMEM;
00228 
00229         lout->type = kin->enctype;
00230         lout->length = kin->length;
00231         memcpy(lout->data, kin->contents, kin->length);
00232 #else
00233         lout->data = malloc(kin->keyvalue.length);
00234         if (lout->data == NULL)
00235                 return KRB5_CC_NOMEM;
00236 
00237         lout->type = kin->keytype;
00238         lout->length = kin->keyvalue.length;
00239         memcpy(lout->data, kin->keyvalue.data, kin->keyvalue.length);
00240 #endif
00241 
00242         return 0;
00243 }
00244 
00245 /* XXX Hack alert! XXX  Do NOT submit upstream! XXX */
00246 /* XXX Hack alert! XXX  Do NOT submit upstream! XXX */
00247 /* XXX Hack alert! XXX  Do NOT submit upstream! XXX */
00248 /* XXX Hack alert! XXX  Do NOT submit upstream! XXX */
00249 /*
00250  * Function to derive a new key from a given key and given constant data.
00251  */
00252 static krb5_error_code
00253 derive_key_lucid(const gss_krb5_lucid_key_t *in, gss_krb5_lucid_key_t *out,
00254                  int usage, char extra)
00255 {
00256         krb5_error_code code;
00257         unsigned char constant_data[K5CLENGTH];
00258         krb5_data datain;
00259         int keylength __attribute__ ((unused));
00260 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00261         void *enc;
00262 #endif
00263         krb5_keyblock kin;  /* must send krb5_keyblock, not lucid! */
00264 #if defined(HAVE_HEIMDAL) || HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY
00265         krb5_context kcontext;
00266         krb5_keyblock *outkey;
00267 #else
00268         krb5_keyblock kout;
00269 #endif
00270 #if HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY
00271         krb5_key key_in, key_out;
00272 #endif
00273 
00274         /*
00275          * XXX Hack alert.  We don't have "legal" access to these
00276          * values and structures located in libk5crypto
00277          */
00278         switch (in->type) {
00279         case ENCTYPE_DES3_CBC_SHA1:
00280 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00281         case ENCTYPE_DES3_CBC_RAW:
00282 #endif
00283                 keylength = 24;
00284 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00285                 enc = &krb5int_enc_des3;
00286 #endif
00287                 break;
00288         case ENCTYPE_AES128_CTS_HMAC_SHA1_96:
00289                 keylength = 16;
00290 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00291                 enc = &krb5int_enc_aes128;
00292 #endif
00293                 break;
00294         case ENCTYPE_AES256_CTS_HMAC_SHA1_96:
00295                 keylength = 32;
00296 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00297                 enc = &krb5int_enc_aes256;
00298 #endif
00299                 break;
00300         default:
00301                 code = KRB5_BAD_ENCTYPE;
00302                 goto out;
00303         }
00304 
00305         /* Convert to correct format for call to krb5_derive_key */
00306         key_lucid_to_krb5(in, &kin);
00307 
00308         datain.data = (char *) constant_data;
00309         datain.length = K5CLENGTH;
00310 
00311         ((char *)(datain.data))[0] = (usage>>24)&0xff;
00312         ((char *)(datain.data))[1] = (usage>>16)&0xff;
00313         ((char *)(datain.data))[2] = (usage>>8)&0xff;
00314         ((char *)(datain.data))[3] = usage&0xff;
00315 
00316         ((char *)(datain.data))[4] = (char) extra;
00317 
00318         /* Step 1: Init context */
00319         /* Heimdal and newer MIT Kerberos require kcontext */
00320 #if defined(HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY) || defined(HAVE_HEIMDAL)
00321         code = krb5_init_context(&kcontext);
00322         if (code)
00323                 goto out;
00324 #endif
00325 
00326         /* Step 2: Get the derived key */
00327 #ifdef HAVE_KRB5
00328 #if HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY
00329         code = krb5_k_create_key(kcontext, &kin, &key_in);
00330         if (code)
00331                 goto out;
00332 
00333         code = krb5int_derive_key(enc, key_in, &key_out, &datain,
00334                                   DERIVE_RFC3961);
00335 
00336         krb5_k_free_key(kcontext, key_in);
00337         if (code == 0) {
00338                 krb5_k_key_keyblock(kcontext, key_out, &outkey);
00339                 krb5_k_free_key(kcontext, key_out);
00340         }
00341 #else  /* !HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY */
00342         out->length = keylength;
00343         out->type = in->type;
00344 
00345         key_lucid_to_krb5(out, &kout);
00346 
00347         code = krb5_derive_key(enc, &kin, &kout, &datain);
00348 #endif  /* HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY */
00349 #else   /* !defined(HAVE_KRB5) */
00350         code = krb5_derive_key(kcontext, &kin, in->type, constant_data, K5CLENGTH, &outkey);
00351 #endif  /* defined(HAVE_KRB5) */
00352 
00353         if (code)
00354                 goto out;
00355 
00356         /* Step 3: Copy the key to out */
00357 #if defined(HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY) || defined(HAVE_HEIMDAL)
00358         code = key_krb5_to_lucid(outkey, out);
00359         krb5_free_keyblock(kcontext, outkey);
00360 #else   /* !defined(HAVE_KRB5) */
00361         code = key_krb5_to_lucid(&kout, out);
00362 #endif  /* defined(HAVE_KRB5) */
00363 
00364         /* Step 4: Free the context */
00365 #if defined(HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY) || defined(HAVE_HEIMDAL)
00366         krb5_free_context(kcontext);
00367 #endif
00368 
00369   out:
00370         if (code)
00371                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s: returning error %d (%s)\n",
00372                          __FUNCTION__, code, error_message(code));
00373         return (code);
00374 }
00375 
00376 
00377 /*
00378  * Prepare a new-style buffer, as defined in rfc4121 (a.k.a. cfx),
00379  * to send to the kernel for newer encryption types -- or for DES3.
00380  *
00381  * The new format is:
00382  *
00383  *      u32 initiate;                   ( whether we are the initiator or not )
00384  *      s32 endtime;
00385  *      u32 flags;
00386  *      #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_INITIATOR         0x00000001
00387  *      #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_CFX               0x00000002
00388  *      #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_ACCEPTOR_SUBKEY   0x00000004
00389  *      u64 seq_send;
00390  *      u32  enctype;                   ( encrption type of keys )
00391  *      u32  size_of_each_key;          ( size of each key in bytes )
00392  *      u32  number_of_keys;            ( N -- should always be 3 for now )
00393  *      keydata-1;                      ( Ke )
00394  *      keydata-2;                      ( Ki )
00395  *      keydata-3;                      ( Kc )
00396  *
00397  */
00398 static int
00399 prepare_krb5_rfc4121_buffer(gss_krb5_lucid_context_v1_t *lctx,
00400                             gss_buffer_desc *buf)
00401 {
00402         static int constant_two = 2;
00403         char *p, *end;
00404         uint32_t v2_flags = 0;
00405         gss_krb5_lucid_key_t enc_key;
00406         gss_krb5_lucid_key_t derived_key;
00407         gss_buffer_desc fakeoid;
00408         uint32_t enctype;
00409         uint32_t keysize;
00410         uint32_t numkeys;
00411 
00412         memset(&enc_key, 0, sizeof(enc_key));
00413         memset(&fakeoid, 0, sizeof(fakeoid));
00414 
00415         if (!(buf->value = calloc(1, MAX_CTX_LEN)))
00416                 goto out_err;
00417         p = buf->value;
00418         end = buf->value + MAX_CTX_LEN;
00419 
00420         /* Version 2 */
00421         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, constant_two)) goto out_err;
00422         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, lctx->endtime)) goto out_err;
00423 
00424         if (lctx->initiate)
00425                 v2_flags |= KRB5_CTX_FLAG_INITIATOR;
00426         if (lctx->protocol != 0)
00427                 v2_flags |= KRB5_CTX_FLAG_CFX;
00428         if (lctx->protocol != 0 && lctx->cfx_kd.have_acceptor_subkey == 1)
00429                 v2_flags |= KRB5_CTX_FLAG_ACCEPTOR_SUBKEY;
00430 
00431         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, v2_flags)) goto out_err;
00432 
00433         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, lctx->send_seq)) goto out_err;
00434 
00435         /* Protocol 0 here implies DES3 or RC4 */
00436         printerr(3, "protocol %d\n", lctx->protocol);
00437         if (lctx->protocol == 0) {
00438                 enctype = lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.type;
00439 #ifdef HAVE_HEIMDAL
00440                 /*
00441                  * The kernel gss code expects ENCTYPE_DES3_CBC_RAW (6) for
00442                  * 3des keys, but Heimdal key has ENCTYPE_DES3_CBC_SHA1 (16).
00443                  * Force the Heimdal enctype to 6.
00444                  */
00445                 if (enctype == ENCTYPE_DES3_CBC_SHA1) {
00446                         printerr(2, "%s: overriding heimdal keytype (%d => %d)\n",
00447                                  __FUNCTION__, enctype, 6);
00448 
00449                         enctype = 6;
00450                 }
00451 #endif
00452                 keysize = lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.length;
00453                 numkeys = 3;    /* XXX is always gonna be three? */
00454         } else {
00455                 if (lctx->cfx_kd.have_acceptor_subkey) {
00456                         enctype = lctx->cfx_kd.acceptor_subkey.type;
00457                         keysize = lctx->cfx_kd.acceptor_subkey.length;
00458                 } else {
00459                         enctype = lctx->cfx_kd.ctx_key.type;
00460                         keysize = lctx->cfx_kd.ctx_key.length;
00461                 }
00462                 numkeys = 3;
00463         }
00464         printerr(3, "serializing %d keys with enctype %d and size %d\n",
00465                  numkeys, enctype, keysize);
00466         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, enctype)) goto out_err;
00467         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, keysize)) goto out_err;
00468         if (WRITE_BYTES(&p, end, numkeys)) goto out_err;
00469 
00470         if (lctx->protocol == 0) {
00471                 /* derive and send down: Ke, Ki, and Kc */
00472                 /* Ke */
00473                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.data,
00474                                 lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.length))
00475                         goto out_err;
00476 
00477                 /* Ki */
00478                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.data,
00479                                 lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.length))
00480                         goto out_err;
00481 
00482                 /* Kc */
00483                 /*
00484                  * RC4 is special, it dosen't need key derivation. Actually
00485                  * the Ke is based on plain text. Here we just let all three
00486                  * key identical, kernel will handle everything. --ericm
00487                  */
00488                 if (lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.type == ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC) {
00489                         if (write_bytes(&p, end, lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.data,
00490                                         lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.length))
00491                                 goto out_err;
00492                 } else {
00493                         if (derive_key_lucid(&lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key,
00494                                         &derived_key,
00495                                         KG_USAGE_SIGN, KEY_USAGE_SEED_CHECKSUM))
00496                                 goto out_err;
00497                         if (write_bytes(&p, end, derived_key.data,
00498                                         derived_key.length))
00499                                 goto out_err;
00500                         free(derived_key.data);
00501                 }
00502         } else {
00503                 gss_krb5_lucid_key_t *keyptr;
00504                 uint32_t sign_usage, seal_usage;
00505 
00506                 if (lctx->cfx_kd.have_acceptor_subkey)
00507                         keyptr = &lctx->cfx_kd.acceptor_subkey;
00508                 else
00509                         keyptr = &lctx->cfx_kd.ctx_key;
00510 
00511 #if 0
00512                 if (lctx->initiate == 1) {
00513                         sign_usage = KG_USAGE_INITIATOR_SIGN;
00514                         seal_usage = KG_USAGE_INITIATOR_SEAL;
00515                 } else {
00516                         sign_usage = KG_USAGE_ACCEPTOR_SIGN;
00517                         seal_usage = KG_USAGE_ACCEPTOR_SEAL;
00518                 }
00519 #else
00520                 /* FIXME
00521                  * These are from rfc4142, but I don't understand: if we supply
00522                  * different 'usage' value for client & server, then the peers
00523                  * will have different derived keys. How could this work?
00524                  *
00525                  * Here we simply use old SIGN/SEAL values until we find the
00526                  * answer.  --ericm
00527                  * FIXME
00528                  */
00529                 sign_usage = KG_USAGE_SIGN;
00530                 seal_usage = KG_USAGE_SEAL;
00531 #endif
00532 
00533                 /* derive and send down: Ke, Ki, and Kc */
00534 
00535                 /* Ke */
00536                 if (derive_key_lucid(keyptr, &derived_key,
00537                                seal_usage, KEY_USAGE_SEED_ENCRYPTION))
00538                         goto out_err;
00539                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, derived_key.data,
00540                                 derived_key.length))
00541                         goto out_err;
00542                 free(derived_key.data);
00543 
00544                 /* Ki */
00545                 if (derive_key_lucid(keyptr, &derived_key,
00546                                seal_usage, KEY_USAGE_SEED_INTEGRITY))
00547                         goto out_err;
00548                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, derived_key.data,
00549                                 derived_key.length))
00550                         goto out_err;
00551                 free(derived_key.data);
00552 
00553                 /* Kc */
00554                 if (derive_key_lucid(keyptr, &derived_key,
00555                                sign_usage, KEY_USAGE_SEED_CHECKSUM))
00556                         goto out_err;
00557                 if (write_bytes(&p, end, derived_key.data,
00558                                 derived_key.length))
00559                         goto out_err;
00560                 free(derived_key.data);
00561         }
00562 
00563         buf->length = p - (char *)buf->value;
00564         return 0;
00565 
00566 out_err:
00567         printerr(0, "ERROR: %s: failed serializing krb5 context for kernel\n",
00568                  __FUNCTION__);
00569         if (buf->value) {
00570                 free(buf->value);
00571                 buf->value = NULL;
00572         }
00573         buf->length = 0;
00574         if (enc_key.data) {
00575                 free(enc_key.data);
00576                 enc_key.data = NULL;
00577         }
00578         return -1;
00579 }
00580 int
00581 serialize_krb5_ctx(gss_ctx_id_t ctx, gss_buffer_desc *buf)
00582 {
00583         OM_uint32 maj_stat, min_stat;
00584         void *return_ctx = 0;
00585         OM_uint32 vers;
00586         gss_krb5_lucid_context_v1_t *lctx = 0;
00587         int retcode = 0;
00588 
00589         printerr(3, "lucid version!\n");
00590         maj_stat = gss_krb5_export_lucid_sec_context(&min_stat, &ctx,
00591                                                 1, &return_ctx);
00592         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00593                 pgsserr("gss_krb5_export_lucid_sec_context",
00594                         maj_stat, min_stat, &krb5oid);
00595                 goto out_err;
00596         }
00597 
00598         /* Check the version returned, we only support v1 right now */
00599         vers = ((gss_krb5_lucid_context_version_t *)return_ctx)->version;
00600         switch (vers) {
00601         case 1:
00602                 lctx = (gss_krb5_lucid_context_v1_t *) return_ctx;
00603                 break;
00604         default:
00605                 printerr(0, "ERROR: unsupported lucid sec context version %d\n",
00606                         vers);
00607                 goto out_err;
00608                 break;
00609         }
00610 
00611         /*
00612          * Now lctx points to a lucid context that we can send down to kernel
00613          *
00614          * Note: we send down different information to the kernel depending
00615          * on the protocol version and the enctyption type.
00616          * For protocol version 0 with all enctypes besides DES3, we use
00617          * the original format.  For protocol version != 0 or DES3, we
00618          * send down the new style information.
00619          */
00620 
00621         if (lctx->protocol == 0 && lctx->rfc1964_kd.ctx_key.type <= 4)
00622                 retcode = prepare_krb5_rfc1964_buffer(lctx, buf);
00623         else
00624                 retcode = prepare_krb5_rfc4121_buffer(lctx, buf);
00625 
00626         maj_stat = gss_krb5_free_lucid_sec_context(&min_stat, return_ctx);
00627         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00628                 pgsserr("gss_krb5_export_lucid_sec_context",
00629                         maj_stat, min_stat, &krb5oid);
00630                 printerr(0, "WARN: failed to free lucid sec context\n");
00631         }
00632 
00633         if (retcode) {
00634                 printerr(1, "%s: prepare_krb5_*_buffer failed (retcode = %d)\n",
00635                          __FUNCTION__, retcode);
00636                 goto out_err;
00637         }
00638 
00639         return 0;
00640 
00641 out_err:
00642         printerr(0, "ERROR: failed serializing krb5 context for kernel\n");
00643         return -1;
00644 }
00645 
00646 
00647 
00648 #endif /* HAVE_LUCID_CONTEXT_SUPPORT */
